quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Einstein and Year
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, protein, muscles. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During WWII, Einstein was paid $25 per day for his consultation on the Manhattan Project.
Sore muscles should be excercised...

options.text: Never as it might damage the muscle
It depends which muscle it is
Always as it helps heal the soreness
Only youre not sore to the touch

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Only youre not sore to the touch

questions.question: In what year did Einstein pass away?
What important thing did Einstein do on August 2nd, 1939?

options.text: He proved the Theory of Special Relativity
He found the speed of light

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He wrote a letter

questions.question: In which US city did Einstein live out his last years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princeton, New Jersey

questions.question: If you eat more protein, youll build more muscle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Somewhat True

questions.question: Lifting incredibly slowly builds incredibly big muscles. Lifting super slowly produces superlong workouts.
Leg extensions are safer for your knees than squats.
During this year, Einstein had three incredible papers published in the physics journals, and obtained his doctoral degree.

On Friday evenings it was the custom of Jewish families to invite college students over for a home cooked meal. One of the students the Einsteins often ate with introduced Albert to science.  What was his name ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Max Talmud

questions.question: The fact that stretching prevents injuries is a myth.
In 1948 Albert Einstein was offered this new job.

options.text: Head of the Institute for Advanced Study
Chief of the Atomic Energy Commission

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: President of Israel

questions.question: Which type of car did Einstein own while in the USA ?
In which year was Albert Einstein born?
You need a Swiss ball to build a stronger chest and shoulders.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Unit and Salt
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, electromagnetism. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Health specialists still argue about the maximum daily salt intake. But it is for sure that if you overdose on salt, it may affect your health negatively. What is likely to happen if you add too much salt in your diet?

options.text: It may bring you high blood pressure
It can lead to electrolyte disturbance

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these meals would be most suitable for a low carb diet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An apple with cottage cheese

questions.question: Which of the following foods is poorest in carbohydrates?
Which term refers to the efficiency of an electric machine, measured in watt hours or kilowatt hours?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Energy Efficiency

questions.question: What is the building block of green plants that cant be broken down into sugar molecules and passes through the human body undigested?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dietary fiber

questions.question: Cod liver oil is often used in many diets and healthy regimes, as a powerful source of omega-3, vitamin A and D. Some medical specialists believe that in the summer months cod liver oil should not be taken, for what reason?

options.text: Because Vitamin D becomes toxic when heated
Because the pills melt in hot weather and it is easy to overdose
Because cod liver oil contains vitamin D, and the sun also creates vitamin D.  If vitamin D is overdosed, your face may become spotty

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because cod liver oil contains vitamin D, and the sun also creates vitamin D.  If vitamin D is overdosed, your face may become spotty

questions.question: Which of these people would be able to successfully combine their regimes with a low carb diet without having to violate one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A vegetarian

questions.question: Which of the following fats contain trans-fats?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Partially hydrogenated fats

questions.question: Which of these is especially rich in omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flax seed

questions.question: This unit, named after the German physicist who discovered the relation between voltage and current, is the basic unit of electrical resistance.
It is better to work out with free weights.
Which of these types of fat raises both LDL(bad cholesterol) and HDL(good cholesterol)?
This unit,  named after one of the main discoverers of electromagnetism, is the base unit of electrical current.
Trans-fats are definitely unwholesome. Which of these foods is poorest in trans fatty acids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sunflower oil

questions.question: Which term refers to the number of complete cycles of an alternating current that occur per second?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Blood and Type
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, profession, communication. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This term refers to the distance between repeating units of a wave pattern and is commonly designated by the Greek letter lambda (λ).
What percentage of humans have type O blood?

options.text: There is no way to tell.

questions.question: Which type of blood cells can be stored the longest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erythrocytes (red blood cells)

questions.question: Barbers traditionally have red and white poles in front of their stores because in the Middle Ages they did the blood letting.
What is the unit of power that shows how fast a circuit uses electrical energy?
The members of which profession used to be called leechers” because of the methods they used in the past?
Approximately what percentage of humans have blood of the type Rh +?
How much blood does the average adult human have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10-12 pints (5-6 liters)

questions.question: What substance is added to blood to keep it from clotting until it is needed?
Which fictional character had T-Negative blood type?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Spock

questions.question: Moonbounce is a form of wireless communication in which the moon is used as a passive satellite.
Lower frequencies have longer wavelengths, while higher frequencies have shorter wavelengths.
What is the basic unit of electric pressure, also known as emf?
Which blood type is called the universal recipient?
An insulator is a thin metal strip mounted in a holder. When too much current passes through  it, the metal strip melts and opens the circuit.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Oil and Blood
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, field, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1658 he became the first person to describe and observe red blood cells (erythrocytes).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jan Swammerdan

questions.question: The term ‘petrodollar’, a dollar earned by a country through the sale of oil, was invented in 1973 by this Egyptian-born American professor and economist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ibrahim Oweiss

questions.question: In 1924 who was the German mathematician who developed a proof showing that blood types were genetic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Felix Bernstein

questions.question: This oil field, located south of Beaumont, Texas, and discovered by Anthony Francis Lucas, was the first major oil field in the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spindletop Oil Field

questions.question: In 1991, one of the most serious oil spills in history brought considerable damage to wildlife in the Middle East region. What caused the oil spill?

options.text: Iraqi forces deliberately released crude oil from several tankers
Tanker Exxon Valdez hit an undersea reef
Nowruz Field platform spilled 80 million gallons of oil
Ixtoc I oil well suffered a blowout

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iraqi forces deliberately released crude oil from several tankers

questions.question: In 1863 this entrepreneur and his partners founded Standard Oil, a company which dominated oil production in the USA for decades.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Rockefeller

questions.question: This person developed the first system to produce donatable blood plasma and was the first director of a Red Cross Blood Bank in the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Richard Drew

questions.question: Which of these statements about Petroleum, sometimes called ‘black gold’, is not true?

options.text: It is used for the production of solvents, fertilizers and plastics.
It is found in formations in he Earth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a renewable resource.

questions.question: The first oil refinery in the world, bombarded in 1943 by US Air Force in operation Tidal Wave, was built in this country in 1856.
This industrial facility, sometimes called a ‘tank farm’ or a ‘terminal’, is used for the storage of oil.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oil depot

questions.question: Who was the first physician to demonstrate that arteries carry blood throughout the body?
Which of these people is the Austrian biologist and physician who first identified the four basic blood types?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karl Landsteiner

questions.question: This American oil driller, dug the first modern oil well near Titusville, Pennsylvania in 1859.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edwin Drake

questions.question: Healthy people over 17 can donate what part of their blood every two weeks?

The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) is an intergovernmental organization founded at the Baghdad Conference in September 1960, by 5 countries. Which of these countries was not a founding member of the organization?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Study and Word
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, astronomer, bowling. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What do we call the study of male health and male diseases?
What is the study of whales called?
What does actinology study?

options.text: The study of the effect of light on chemicals

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The study of the effect of light on chemicals

questions.question: Which term refers to the study of atmospheric dust and its effect on life on Earth?
What does ludology study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: video games

questions.question: What is contrology?
Which statement is incorrect?

options.text: Boxology studies schematic layouts and diagrams.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerontology studies grammar and syntax.

questions.question: According to gravity laws, if a bowling ball and a feather are dropped simultaneously from the same height the bowling ball will hit the ground first because it has greater inertia. (In this case we ignore the effects of air resistance.)
What does psephology study?
What does dactylology study?

English physicist, mathematician, and astronomer Sir Isaac Newton presented his findings on the universal law of gravity in his work commonly referred to as Principia Mathematica, which was published in what year?
This is the study of winds.
Which word means the study of dogs?
The Arab-Israeli War in 1973, known as Yom Kippur War, triggered the ‘1973 oil crisis’. What action did the Arab members of OPEC undertake as part of their strategy?

options.text: They raised the price of oil
They proclaimed an embargo on oil exports to the Netherlands
They proclaimed an embargo on oil exports to the United States

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which word refers to the study of bones?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Gravity and Weight
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, condition, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: An object in free fall towards the Earth experiences acceleration in velocity due to gravity. This acceleration has what approximate value?

options.text: 8.1 meters per a second squared (26.6 feet per a second squared)
9.8 meters per a second squared (32 feet per a second squared)
32 meters per a second squared (9.8 meters per a second squared)
26.6 meters per a second squared (8.1 feet per a second squared)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9.8 meters per a second squared (32 feet per a second squared)

questions.question: The best diet is a permanent lifestyle change.
What is the ideal body weight for a woman with average bone structure who is 5 feet 5 inches tall?
If 2 people are eating the same number of calories per day, the one who eats frequent small meals will lose more weight than the one who eats one large meal per day.
Artificial gravity is a simulation of gravity in outer space. There are several means by which artificial gravity can be created. Which of the following is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Field generators

questions.question: How many calories (kcal) is equivalent to one pound?
A diet high in sugar and starch has more energy, so people who eat such a diet do not get as hungry as people who eat a diet low in sugar and starch.

Free-fall is defined as a condition in which a falling object experiences acceleration due only to gravity. Therefore, in this case, the only weight acting on an object is its own weight. Which of the following is not an example of an object in free-fall?

options.text: A skydiver with an open parachute
A feather falling through a vacuum tube
The Earths orbit around the Sun
A space shuttle with the rockets off

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A skydiver with an open parachute

questions.question: If we measure the acceleration due to gravity at the top of Mount Everest, it will be less than the acceleration at sea level.
Low-fat foods contain very little if any sugar.
Running a mile burns approximately 100 calories (100 Kcal).
What is the ideal body weight for a six-foot-tall man with average bone structure?

Although Newtons and Einsteins theories are generally widely accepted and used in many fields of science, there are some researchers who have developed alternative theories of gravity. Which of the following is one of these theories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brans-Dicke Theory

questions.question: Although gravity has been a subject of much research and scientific work, the actual cause of gravitational forces remains unknown.
The gravitational force on the surface of the Sun is greater than the gravitational force on Earths surface. If you weigh 180 lbs or 80 kg on Earth, what would your weight be on the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5022 lbs (2270 kg)
